conclusion: Four identical blocks (A, B, C, D) on a smooth horizontal surface.
Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring.
A horizontal pulling force F is applied to block B.
All blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration.
In the second image, we see F = 4ma.
In the third image, we see forces f = ma acting between blocks.
All blocks have the same mass m.
All blocks have the same acceleration a.
The external force F = 4ma.
The blocks must be in contact with each other since they move together.
Block B has a pulling force F = 4ma to the right.
Block B has a spring force to the left (connecting to block C).
Block B has a contact force from block A to the left.
Block A has a contact force from block B to the right.
Block A has no other horizontal forces.
Block C has a spring force to the right (connecting to block B).
Block C has a contact force from block D to the left.
Block D has a contact force from block C to the right.

premise: Block D has a contact force from block C to the right.
conclusion: For block D to accelerate with acceleration a, there must be a net force of ma acting on it.

premise: There is no external force directly applied to D.
conclusion: The force must be coming from the contact with block C.

premise: The force must be coming from the contact with block C.
conclusion: The static friction force on block D must be f = ma (to the right).
